column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Finishing our bruschetta it was another 20 minutes before the young lady arrived to tell us our pizza would be out soon.  Interestingly
column2: my mother began sorting plates from the center of the table at this time and noted one to be quite dirty.  Showing this to the server the server stated "hmm
column4: all our plates are in the washer now but I'll see if I can find one."  With nearly twenty Lou's operating in Illinois
column5: I'd like to think their flagship would have a bit more tableware - or that someone in the place could hand wash a dish.
